page.title: 08ABERDEEN AIRPORT - 2
page.content:
{Interviews with airport personnel} Mr McCombie,{head of security,}is in charge of 80 people. They search baggage using a special machine which detects radioactive material, poisons etc. The growth of passengers has made their job increasingly important. Luggage is restricted to 20 kilos per passenger. Porters are employed to load it into aircraft. The airport fire station employs 26 people and has been in operation for 50 years.
Mr Barlow,{airport manager,}told us that 2378 helicopters take off and land each month.
{The airport does not cause great {nuisance to people in Dyce. Most {people regard it as very important to {the town.
